text: Bruno Da Col (born 25 February 1913, date of death unknown) was an Italian ski jumper. He competed at the 1936 Winter Olympics and the 1948 Winter Olympics. In the town of Ponte di Legno, Da Col completed the first ski jump over 100 meters in Italy. He later received a medal of honor for his achievements from Benito Mussolini.http://www.skisprungschanzen.com/EN/Ski+Jumps/ITA- Italy/Ponte+di+Legno/0333-Gigante+Corno+d’Aola/ ==References== Category:1913 births Category:Year of death missing Category:Italian male ski jumpers Category:Olympic ski jumpers of Italy Category:Ski jumpers at the 1936 Winter Olympics Category:Ski jumpers at the 1948 Winter Olympics Category:Place of birth missing
title: Bruno Da Col
